field_reports.description:
On December 25, at 11:30 local time, a passenger aircraft operated by Azerbaijan Airlines crashed three kilometers from Aktau, the administrative center of the Mangystau region. The aircraft, en route from Baku to Grozny, was diverted to Makhachkala due to unfavorable weather conditions in Grozny and was subsequently redirected to Aktau.
While flying over the Caspian Sea, the aircraft issued a distress signal. Upon arrival at the crash site, rescuers found the plane on fire, which was promptly extinguished.

Information about Passengers and Casualties

There were 67 people on board, including five crew members. The passenger composition by nationality was as follows:

  • 42 Azerbaijani citizens
  • 16 Russian citizens
  • 6 Kazakhstani citizens
  • 3 Kyrgyzstani citizens

Outcome of the Incident:

  • 38 fatalities.
  • 29 survivors were transported to medical facilities, including two children aged 11 and 16.

Among the injured:

  • 7 individuals are in critical condition and have been admitted to intensive care.

results.name: KAZ: Transport Emergency - 12-2024 - Plane crash

field_reports.description:
The area where floods are spreading is increasing. The President of the country called the floods "a natural disaster, possibly the biggest in 80 years".
A local emergency has been declared in 10 regions (Akmola, Aktobe, Atyrau, West Kazakhstan, Karaganda, Kostanay, Pavlodar, North Kazakhstan, Ulytau (part of the former Karaganda region), Abai (part of the former East Kazakhstan region).

Flooded remain 3,698 private houses in six regions. Overflows continue on 155 sections of the roads. 58 settlements are without transport communication, delivery of food and medicines is carried out.

74,942 people were evacuated from the emergency zones, 17,914 of them children. 14,460 people, including 7,269 children, are in temporary accommodation centres.

In 7 regions due to precipitation, temperature rise and snow melting, the water level in water bodies is expected to rise further. Peak water level in West Kazakhstan and North Kazakhstan regions will be reached next week, and after that will move to Atyrau region.

According to weather forecasts, warm weather will continue in the near future. Intensive melting of snow and filling of reservoirs will continue. Today, the area of snow cover in the country as a whole is 15%, and in the northern, eastern and central regions - about 40%.

As a result of floods in the regions of Kazakhstan killed 5,711 farm animals, 1,013 of which have already been utilised. More than 60,000 farm animals have been relocated so far.

Two people died in Atyrau region. According to the Ministry of Emergency Situations, they drove a tractor towards a flooded apartment block, drove off the road into a ditch and overturned.
field_reports.summary: KAZ: Flood - 03-2024 - Floods in several regions #3 (2024-04-08)

contacts.name: Zafarbek Quvvatbekov
contacts.title: Operations Coordinator. Country Delegation in Tajikistan

countries.society_name: Red Crescent Society of the Republic of Kazakhstan
countries.name: Kazakhstan

field_reports.description:
Due to warming temperatures and heavy rains, flooding has begun in several regions of the country. Currently, local authorities have declared a state of emergency in six regions of the country. More than 13 thousand people have been evacuated and more than 1,500 private houses have been flooded. There are 6,461 people in temporary accommodation centres, including 2,570 children. 53 settlements remain without transport communication. The floods are not yet past their peak and are expected to intensify and occur in several more regions.
6,930 people, 1,895 vehicles, 772 water-pumping means and 68 swimming means, eight aircrafts of the Ministry of Emergency Situations, Ministry of Internal Affairs, Ministry of Defence, local executive bodies and organisations are involved in rescue operations.
field_reports.summary: KAZ: Flood - 03-2024 - Floods in several regions #2 (2024-04-01)

countries.name: Kazakhstan

field_reports.description:
Due to warming temperatures and heavy rains, flooding has begun in several regions of the country. Currently, local authorities have declared a state of emergency in four regions of the country. More than 2 thousand people have been evacuated and more than 300 private houses have been flooded. Floods are expected in several more regions in the near future.
Republican and 12 regional emergency response headquarters have been deployed. The army and military aviation have been involved.
Directors of the Red Crescent branches participate in the work of the headquarters as members of local interdepartmental commissions on emergencies.  Assessment of the situation by the Red Crescent staff is difficult due to the fact that roads are washed out and water is standing in the settlements.
field_reports.summary: KAZ: Flood - 03-2024 - Floods in several regions

results.name: KAZ: Flood - 03-2024 - Floods in several regions
results.summary:
As a result of increasing temperatures and heavy rainfall, several regions of the Republic of Kazakhstan have been affected by heavy flooding. Local authorities have declared a state of emergency in ten regions of the country. Water levels are expected to rise in further seven regions due to precipitation and as the increasing temperature is melting the snow.

According to the Ministry of Water Resources and Irrigation, flooding has already reached its peak in Akmola, Aktobe, and Karaganda regions, while, in the East-Kazakhstan region, the peak is anticipated in a week. A second wave of floods is further anticipated in the West-Kazakhstan region.

Disburse of water at the Iriklinsky hydroelectric power station in the Russian Federation is still high; the water is expected to reach the border of Kazakhstan in an estimated 15 - 20 days, threatening the settlements in West-Kazakhstan and Atyrau regions. In Kostanai region, the average filling of two main reservoirs is 96 per cent, with water levels growing. The two main reservoirs of North-Kazakhstan region are filled up to 100 per cent and 180 per cent, with an overflow at a record level of 415 cm, putting three districts at risk of flooding in the region.

According to weather forecasts, temperatures will continue to rise in the near future, further melting snow at a high pace and filling reservoirs to their limits. At the time of this IFRC Disaster Response Emergency Fund (DREF) application, the area of snow cover in Kazakhstan is 15 per cent, with an approximate 40 per cent in the northern, eastern, and central regions of the country.Â

field_reports.description: On October 28, an explosion occurred at a mine in the Karaganda region. The methane explosion occurred at a depth of 700 meters, and its shock wave spread over a distance of more than two kilometers. It affected not only the area of the accident, but also neighboring areas.The range of propagation of the shock wave was more than 2 km. As a result of the explosion, 46 people were killed.
field_reports.summary: KAZ: Other - 2023-10 - Accident in Karaganda mine

results.name: KAZ: Other - 2023-10 - Accident in Karaganda mine
results.summary: On October 28, an explosion occurred at a mine in the Karaganda region. The methane explosion occurred at a depth of 700 meters, and its shock wave spread over a distance of more than two kilometers. It affected not only the area of the accident, but also neighboring areas.The range of propagation of the shock wave was more than 2 km. As a result of the explosion, 45 people were killed, the search for one miner continues.

field_reports.description:
Emergency mode was introduced in six districts of Zhambyl region

Due to the abnormal heat and lack of irrigation water in the Bayzak, Zhambyl, Kordai, Merken, T.Ryskulov and Talas districts, an emergency was introduced, the akimat of Zhambyl region reported

The issue of allocating funds from the government's emergency reserve to cover farmers' losses is being resolved. The akimat reported that this year the crop losses will be 25-30 percent more compared to last year. The amount of damage to farms will be determined before the end of the growing season, and in the coming days they will specify the area of unsuitable fields and the amount of losses

Minister of Agriculture Yerbol Karashukeyev said that due to the small flow of water from Kyrgyzstan, about 7.8 thousand hectares were affected in the Zhambyl region, including 1.2 thousand hectares of sugar beet

field_reports.description:
As a result of heavy precipitation, there was a slope runoff, which is the cause of flooding of houses in several settlements.

 

The Almaty regional branch of the Red Crescent has completed an assessment of the situation in the Jetysui region.

 

Eskeldinsky district, Abay village - 3 houses, 16 people;

Eshkiolmes village - 27 houses, 120 people.

People's property was damaged, including household appliances, furniture, shoes, clothes.

In the Koksu district, village of Mambet, where 5 houses were damaged, the assessment has not yet been carried out.

field_reports.description:
Due to the large consumption of mains water in heating systems 

On 27.11.2022 , there was a stop of boilers at the TPS of Ekibastuz.

In this connection, 689 multi-storey residential buildings, 5672 residential private houses, 1205 others were transferred to reduced heat supply. 

Of these, in order to minimize the defrosting of the internal heating system, heating networks were emptied in 149 multi-storey, 114 private houses and 15 social facilities in mkrn. 5A, 5B and 6, the population of 44,178 people.

As of 11.00 a.m. on 11/29/2022, 6 boilers No. 6,8,9,12,14,15 are in operation; 4 boilers (No. 5,7,11,13) are in reserve. The supply of mains water has been reduced from 1200 tons/hour to 800 (at a rate of 400). Heat supply has been restored in 132 multi-storey,

114 private houses and 13 social facilities in mkrn. 5A, 5B and 6, 17 multi-storey residential buildings, 2 educational facilities and 1 administrative building remain disconnected from central heating.

Akim of Ekibastuz declared an emergency of a technogenic nature on a local scale (decision No. 3 of 11/28/2022). A hotline was opened in Pavlodar and Ekibastuz, 1125 calls were received. The regional operational headquarters is deployed in the Emergency Situation Room. 123 people (39 adults, 84 children) were evacuated from the city of Ekibastuz to Pavlodar.

In total, 152 people and 40 pieces of equipment are involved in emergency recovery work. Since November 28, the educational facilities of Ekibastuz have switched

to a distance learning format. Kindergartens will not work until further notice.

According to the RSE "Kazhydromet" on November 29 this year in Ekibastuz, the air temperature will be 20-250C in the afternoon, the wind is south-easterly 5-10 m/s, without precipitation.
field_reports.summary: KAZ: Other - 2022-11 - Termination of the thermal power plant

field_reports.description:
02.09. at 15-10 on the territory of the Basmansky, Semiozerny forestry farms of the Auliekolsky district of the Kostanay region, trees and dry grass caught fire. 

03.09 due to the complication of the meteorological situation, including a high air temperature of 36 degrees, storm gusts of wind up to 23 m / s, the fire area exceeded 9,400 hectares.

There was a threat to settlements , therefore , the evacuation of 1,841 people from the village was carried out . Ozernoye (250 people) and the northern part of Amankaragai village (1000 people), Kalinino village (228 people), Lesnoye village (363 people).

The evacuees were placed in the Auliekol secondary school and the Auliekol boarding school provided them with food.

A hotline of the Ministry of Emergency Situations has been opened, the work of psychologists of the Ministry of Emergency Situations and Emergency Situations of Kostanay region has been organized.

Akimat of Kostanay region is working on the issue of declaring a local emergency. 

Starting from 16.00 on 09/3/2022 , the transition of the fire to residential buildings was registered . Ozernoye (8 residential buildings, 1 administrative building),

Lesnoye village (1 residential building), Amankaragai village (98 residential buildings and outbuildings), the territory of the Amankaragai oil depot as a result, 108 buildings were destroyed and damaged by fire.

UPD:
As of September 6, 11 people received injuries, burns, poisoning of mild and moderate severity: six local residents, including one minor, one forestry worker, one akimat employee, three emergency workers. They were referred for outpatient treatment.

The ministry recalled that during the analysis of the rubble in the village of Amankaragai, the body of a man born in 1935 was found.

The fire is still being extinguished at five sites: in the area of the villages of Amankaragai, Lesnoye, Ozernoye, Baganaly and Kalinino, as well as in the forest zone with a total edge length of 5 km. From 350 to 7,500 people live in each village.

According to the operational headquarters, the fire damaged 91 residential buildings. Firefighting continues.

UPD:
The fire is extinguished, evacuation points are empty. The state will build houses for people whose homes have been completely destroyed. The distribution of humanitarian aid from the authorities and the Red Crescent continues.

field_reports.description:
To date, the loss of livestock in the Turkestan and Mangistau region continues due to the lack of feed stocks in the affected population, as well as the drying up of rivers and reservoirs. The situation is complicated by the lack of precipitation in the region. 

Among the main needs of the affected population are livestock feed, as well as means of subsistence (basic needs). Due to the loss of livestock, which is the only source of income, as well as the lack of any additional work, the population is experiencing an acute need for basic needs, which can be provided by the assistance provided under Operation DREF.

The situation with COVID-19 in the regions included in the operation zone is stable for now. As of 18.09.2021, 2 991 new cases of infection were registered per day. New cases of infection In the regions of the operation: Mangistau region-14, Turkestan-58 new cases. A total of 862 862,064 people have been confirmed in the country since the appearance of COVID-19 on the territory of the Republic of Kazakhstan.

countries.society_name: Red Crescent Society of the Republic of Kazakhstan
countries.name: Kazakhstan

field_reports.description: On July 12, a state of emergency was declared in the Aral District, Kyzylorda region due to a severe drought. Also, the Red Crescent of Kazakhstan received a request from the local administration of the Turkestan and Mangistau regions to provide assistance to the affected population from the drought. At the moment, assistance in the Kyzylorda region will be provided by state organizations and a partner of the Red Crescent from the commercial sector with the assistance of the regional branch of the National Society. In turn, to provide assistance in the Turkestan and Mangistau regions, the Red Crescent of Kazakhstan intends to make a request for assistance to the DREF.
field_reports.summary: Kazakhstan - Mangistau, South Kazakhstan and Kyzylorda\Drought

countries.society_name: Red Crescent Society of the Republic of Kazakhstan
countries.name: Kazakhstan

field_reports.gov_affected_pop_centres: Aral region - Kyzylorda region, Karaganda region, South Kazakhstan region
field_reports.description:
In the Republic of Kazakhstan the heat wave that began on July, 2021 in a Southern, Western, Central and Eastern regions of the country, led to record temperatures of up to 46.5â (recorded on July 7) in the region with a norm of 28.3â. It also seriously affected the main cattle breeding farms. According to the local meteorological service "Kazgydromet", the removal of hot and dry air masses from the region of Iran keeps the abnormal hot weather on the territory of most of the Republic of Kazakhstan. A low-grade abnormal heat is observed throughout the country, which has so far led to several hundred deaths among people with chronic diseases. 

As a result of the abnormally high air temperature, rapid drainage of rivers and reservoirs occurs in various regions of the country. Also, the soil dries to a depth of up to 50 cm, which caused the lack of vegetation and natural feed in the grazing areas. Based on the impossibility of grazing, the minimum feed and drinking reserves are exhausted, which leads to a mass death. To date, the death of more than 2000 units of livestock has been recorded (in whole country).  

The branches of the Red Crescent of Kazakhstan are currently assessing the situation and negotiating with local administration to determine the key needs of the affected population. Large-scale information work is also being carried out to counteract the fires that are raging in some regions of the country.
